data.title: Reduced Brainfck Interpreter
data.statement:
You are given a single <<String>> which represents a program written in a reduced version of the esoteric language Brainf*ck. 

Each <<Character>> of the <<String>> represents a single command/opcode. These commands operate on a <<Array of Integers>> which you must maintain. The <<Integers in the Array>> are like cells in memory, which the commands manipulate.

The <<Array>> must be zero-indexed with length {{10000}}, the <<Integers>> default value is {{0}}, and the starting position is the first cell (with index {{0}}). It represents the [[Current index]]. The commands are:

{{>}} Increment the [[Current index]] by one (to point to the next cell to the right). If the [[Current index]] is 9999 (the last cell of the Array) it moves to index {{0}}.
{{<}} Decrement the [[Current index]] by one (to point to the next cell to to the left). If the [[Current index]] is 0 (the first cell of the Array) it moves to index {{9999}}.
{{+}} Increment the cell (the value of the Integer) at the [[Current index]] of the Array by one.
{{-}} Decrement the cell (the value of the Integer) at the [[Current index]] of the Array by one.

Execute all the commands of the given program and output the sum of <<all the cells which have positive values only>>.

<<Example>>
Input: <-->>>>+++--++
Output: 3

The [[Current index]] was first moved one position to the left (from index 0 to 9999), and the Integer cell there was decremented twice (0 -> -2).
Then, the [[Current index]] was moved four times to the right (from position 9999 to 3) and the Integer cell there was incremented three times, decremented two times, and incremented again two times (0 -> 3 -> 1 -> 3). We skip the value of the first cell (which is negative), so the total sum of the positive cells is 3.
data.constraints:
0 <= [[Current index]] <= 9999
1 <= length of [[programText]] <= 2000
0 <= [[Sum of all the positive cells in the Array]] <= 2^16
data.inputDescription: A single line [[programText]] consisting of the <<String>> of the Brainf*ck program. It can contain <<only>> the following characters:  {{>}}, {{<}}, {{+}}, {{-}}.
data.outputDescription:
After executing all the commands, output a single value:
[[Sum of all the positive cells in the Array]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a single String which represents a program written in a reduced version of the esoteric language Brainf*ck.

Each Character of the String represents a single command/opcode. These commands operate on a Array of Integers which you must maintain. The Integers in the Array are like cells in memory, which the commands manipulate.

The Array must be zero-indexed with length 10000, the Integers default value is 0, and the starting position is the first cell (with index 0). It represents the Current index. The commands are:

> Increment the Current index by one (to point to the next cell to the right). If the Current index is 9999 (the last cell of the Array) it moves to index 0.
< Decrement the Current index by one (to point to the next cell to to the left). If the Current index is 0 (the first cell of the Array) it moves to index 9999.
+ Increment the cell (the value of the Integer) at the Current index of the Array by one.
- Decrement the cell (the value of the Integer) at the Current index of the Array by one.

Execute all the commands of the given program and output the sum of all the cells which have positive values only.

Example
Input: <-->>>>+++--++
Output: 3

The Current index was first moved one position to the left (from index 0 to 9999), and the Integer cell there was decremented twice (0 -> -2).
Then, the Current index was moved four times to the right (from position 9999 to 3) and the Integer cell there was incremented three times, decremented two times, and incremented again two times (0 -> 3 -> 1 -> 3). We skip the value of the first cell (which is negative), so the total sum of the positive cells is 3.
Input
A single line programText consisting of the String of the Brainf*ck program. It can contain only the following characters: >, <, +, -.
Output
After executing all the commands, output a single value:
Sum of all the positive cells in the Array
Constraints
0 <= Current index <= 9999
1 <= length of programText <= 2000
0 <= Sum of all the positive cells in the Array <= 2^16
Example
Input
>++
Output
2
